raw_claims:
```json
        {
            "claims": [
                {
                    "claim_id": 1,
                    "claim_text": "Integrated Gradients is a new attribution method that satisfies two fundamental axioms: Sensitivity and Implementation Invariance.",
                    "location": "Abstract, Section 2",
                    "claim_type": "Methodological Contribution",
                    "exact_quote": "We identify two fundamental axioms—Sensitivity and Implementation Invariance that attribution methods ought to satisfy. We show that they are not satisfied by most known attribution methods, which we consider to be a fundamental weakness of those methods. We use the axioms to guide the design of a new attribution method called Integrated Gradients."
                },
                {
                    "claim_id": 2,
                    "claim_text": "Integrated Gradients does not require any modification to the original network and is extremely simple to implement.",
                    "location": "Abstract, Section 3",
                    "claim_type": "Methodological Contribution",
                    "exact_quote": "Our method requires no modification to the original network and is extremely simple to implement; it just needs a few calls to the standard gradient operator."
                },
                {
                    "claim_id": 3,
                    "claim_text": "Integrated Gradients can be applied to a variety of deep networks including image models, text models, and a chemistry model.",
                    "location": "Abstract, Section 6",
                    "claim_type": "Methodological Contribution",
                    "exact_quote": "We demonstrate the ease of applicability over several deep networks, including two images networks, two text processing networks, and a chemistry network."
                },
                {
                    "claim_id": 4,
                    "claim_text": "Integrated Gradients is the unique path method that is symmetry-preserving.",
                    "location": "Section 4.2",
                    "claim_type": "Theoretical Contribution",
                    "exact_quote": "Integrated gradients is the unique path method that is symmetry-preserving."
                },
                {
                    "claim_id": 5,
                    "claim_text": "Integrated Gradients can be used to debug networks, extract rules from a network, and aid end users in understanding the network’s prediction.",
                    "location": "Abstract, Section 6",
                    "claim_type": "Application",
                    "exact_quote": "We apply this method to a couple of image models, a couple of text models and a chemistry model, demonstrating its ability to debug networks, to extract rules from a network, and to enable users to engage with models better."
                },
                {
                    "claim_id": 6,
                    "claim_text": "Integrated Gradients can be used to identify the importance of individual input features in a deep network's prediction.",
                    "location": "Abstract, Section 5",
                    "claim_type": "Methodological Contribution",
                    "exact_quote": "Our method requires no modification to the original network and is extremely simple to implement; it just needs a few calls to the standard gradient operator."
                },
                {
                    "claim_id": 7,
                    "claim_text": "Integrated Gradients can be used to identify the importance of individual input features in a deep network's prediction.",
                    "location": "Section 5",
                    "claim_type": "Methodological Contribution",
                    "exact_quote": "We apply this method to a couple of image models, a couple of text models and a chemistry model, demonstrating its ability to debug networks, to extract rules from a network, and to enable users to engage with models better."
